reviews.text: This place could be better, it's fast food quality. First of all, the food presentation is great. It looks much like the picture, the problem is the flavor is very "mid" at best. It lacked flavor. Another thing is the service,  they either need to hire more people or make sure their current servers are at the very least more attentive. They're polite and well mannered but it's clear they're swamped. I expected a seat at the bar I would at least have someone to check up on me and make sure I was getting more drinks as time went on but that wasn't the case. I get that this is a chain place, but for a chain place I expected things to go a little more smoothly.

ğŸ½ï¸ Dinner at the Cute Little Restaurant

I went to this really cute restaurant recently â€” the kind of place that just makes you smile when you walk in. The setup is adorable: cozy lights, neat decorations, and everything feels thoughtfully arranged. Itâ€™s the sort of spot that makes you want to stay a little longer, just to soak in the atmosphere.

When the food arrived, it looked great. Nicely plated, colorful, and clearly made with care. I ordered a meat dish, which I was excited about â€” it looked juicy and tender at first glance. But once I tried it, I noticed the texture wasnâ€™t quite as soft as Iâ€™d hoped. It was a little tougher than expected, and there was this faint smell that didnâ€™t sit right with me. Not bad enough to ruin the meal, but definitely something that stood out.

Still, the rest of the experience made up for it â€” the sides were flavorful, the service was friendly, and the price was very reasonable. Itâ€™s one of those places Iâ€™d probably give another try, hoping the next dish nails that perfect tenderness I was craving.

This place was really good!!! The place felt cozy and warm and really good overall! The thing is when I was there the food took really really long to get but it was definitely worth the wait because it was good!

This place has a variety of different kinds of foods. First, their Ramen soup is very good. Their service is great also, the food comes very fast. I recommend noddles lovers to come to this placeğŸ˜Š.

Father daughter dinner date on a nice and cool Friday night. Ordered the new Beef Ramen, my daughter orders the Omurice. Guy takes the order, done. A few minutes later he says Omurice sold out so my daughter orders vegetable ramen. Beef ramen was good  my daughter likes it and I end up with the vegetable ramen. Didn't like the vegetable ramen so we called it a night. All of a sudden I notice they are serving omurice to another customer. I ask for the check and politely ask one of the servers, I saw an omurice served to another customer I thought it was sold out...explanations explanations...until the original server says "I will have it done for you it's my mistake.: At first we didn't want it but hey if they are offering it, that's a good way to redeem the mistake. A tall man hands out the ipad for payment, once I sign he takes the ipad rudely, doesn't say a word after I paid, but brushed it off. 5 min, 10 min, 20 min, 30 min passed until the robot came with a bag, so we thought its the replacement omurice, but the tall man and a lady took it away, no explanation. And we waited and waited until no omurice and we had enough. I set a good example to my daughter didn't make a scene and just walked away. As we were walking out nobody cared, nobody said thank you, the workers pretended nothing happened. The worst part I still gave them an 18% tip. We support local business in Bayside but if the business doesn't give a damn about serving regular folks like me, we go somewhere else.
Food is on the average of what I'd expect, but with smaller portions than desirable. Service is their worst issue, staff isn't openly aggressive, but seems to find customers annoying.

All the food (ramen and skewers) was super salty and just too much. We had 3 different kinds of ramen (miso, tonkotsu, etc.) and they all tasted over-seasoned. We were highly disappointed with every dish.

The bubble tea was so tiny and full of ice--not enough tea. It was not worth the price.

The interior decor was cool but since the food is so bad, I would never go back. This experience turned me off to the chain entirely.
å¥½åƒçˆ±åƒå¤©å¤©åƒ
It was very nice the way that they treat you,  the food delicious!! And the wait it wasnâ€™t too long and the place so clean and fresh.
The food here is really good. The service is also really good especially at Tbaar. The drinks here are unique and unlike anything else
åƒä¸ªç ´åƒåœ¾é¢ é‡Œé¢éƒ½æ²¡äººè¿˜ä¸€ç›´è®©ç«™åœ¨é—¨å£æ’é˜Ÿ çœŸçš„æç¬‘ ç ´åƒåœ¾åœ°æ–¹å†ä¹Ÿä¸æ¥äº† å»damnå§

Interior: beautifully designed, interesting space.  A fascinating tree-like structure in the middle.  Cool booths built into the wall in a honeycomb design.  There was a robot delivering items to tables, which the kids liked.  Decent vibe.

Food: ramen were fine.  Solid but nothing to write home about.

The spicy smashed cucumber salad was too fiery. I *like* heat in my cucumber salad but this was too much.  Couldnâ€™t eat much of it.

I had the signature tonkatsu omurice omelette which is served tableside.  It certainly looks dramatic, and the omelette is goodâ€¦ one of those dishes you would have real difficulties making at home.  However, the tonkatsu which came with it was a fatty, substandard piece of pork.

The kids had flavored lemonade which even they said was too sweet.

Service: wait staff are nice but several items we ordered never came out.  No one checked on us through the mealâ€¦ we had to wave them over.

Overall itâ€™s a fun experience due to the restaurant design but the food and service could be better.

Food is always good but tonight our server Jason was extremely rude. It seemed like he was very bothered by any question or request we had. I always like the food here but because of Jason I wonâ€™t be going back.

Kyuramen is an everything under one roof ramen chain that's great for friends and family gatherings. Ramen, rice, skewers, drinks, and bubble tea, etc.

The few chain locations I've been to are all spacious and able to accommodate groups.

Service and food are on par. They have a lot of options, making it easy for all ages and budget friendly.  Nothing extraordinary but again, definitely top of my go to list for large groups with friends and family.

I got food poisoning! Went yesterday evening (September 27, 2025) with my friends, two of us got sick. I have diarrhea, nausea, cold sweats, etc. still sick currently. Have to miss work tomorrow. Meat was raw, egg was not fully cooked, I gave the meat away, and scrapped out the egg. Decided to eat just the ramen, but still got sick because the broth must have been a bit bloody and terrible. Do not recommend!!!
The ramen tastes really good with flavorful broth and combination of bunch of vegeies.
Yummy in my tummy ğŸ˜‹ğŸ«ƒ
Nice ğŸ‘ğŸ¾

Most amazing ramen experience of my entire lifetime. Beck was a fantastic server. Came with my friends, didn't even want to leave it was so good. My life was changed forever for the better coming here.
This place is delicious, perfect place to go to on a weekend

Everyone enjoyed the food, the service, the atmosphere, but the highlight of the evening was the total respect that we had from KYURAMEN, the fact that they accommodate the whole family including our dog and we have our own place enough for all of us
THANK YOU EVERYONE AT KYURAMEN

Really beautiful location, the best Kyuramen spot in NYC becuase the decor is top notch!! First time doing a large size group, so we were placed in the private seating and it was a wonderful set up. You have buttons that notify the servers that you are ready to order or need assistance, and they even have a robot that serves you meals and boba.

The tonkutso is decently good, not the best best Iâ€™ve ever had, but still very good for the price and experience. The rest of the food (non ramen) are soooo good, like the popcorn chicken. The boba is also soooooo good.

Got the tote bag for my birthday.
Food was very good and flavorful and the service was also very good .

I placed an order via Uber eats and proceeded to pick up as uber eats said my order was ready. I arrived at the pick up counter and gave my name. The hostess said that my order was not ready yet, which was fine. I told her I would sit at the bench and wait. This bench is directly on the side of the pick up counter. I waited. I waited for 20 additional minutes and got up and decided to ask about my order. I gave my name again to another young lady that was there next to the hostess I spoke to earlier. She picked up my bag right behind the counter. My order was just sitting there for awhile and the hostess never called to me to retrieve it. It was late, it was not busy nor was she busy doing anything when it was given to me. No apologies were offered or acknowledgement. I will not be returning.
Good service and good food.

Great ramen and there package deal arw good to pork bum and thai ice tea are great choices

Slow to little customer service.  Waiters only came to deliver food.  They never checked on our table.  Spent 2 hours in there and it was fairly empty, so the wait was 100% due to inattentive staff.   Got the creamy udon which was okay - only thing that turned me off is the wooden base had old rice caked onto it.  It took forever to get the bill (also to know, a party of 4 sat across from us, came in after us, got their bill and left before us).  Would not go back to this location.  3 stars is solely for the food.

OMG this is a hidden gem if you want to eat Japanese food definitely recommend there omirice meal. They even let you see how they cut. Will come back. Service Absolutely Phenomenal. They were very respectful and helpful.

Today Aug 12,2025, visited restaurant and to my surprise was very disappointed with service and their food. We had the following dishes, HoneyComb platter, which was not tasty at all. Popcorn chicken was dried over cooked so was the tempura. Tempura had no taste , appeared to taste like Costco tempura. I also ordered the rice burger with fries, also tasteless, fries very salty. Beef Ramen was ok nothing to be thrilled about. It appears the cooking oil being used , has been used a number of times and not fresh. The service was mediocre, some were on their cell phone, had to call the waiter a number of times over for water. The ambiance was ok. The place is very clean as well as its bathroom. When paying the bill an automatic tip of 18% added. I travelled a lot and go to many restaurants to try different ethnic foods and consider myself a foodie who likes to rate the food, service and ambience to let other customers know how was the service. That is why I gave it a 1 star rating. I go to many Asian restaurants in NY and when I travel as well.
Disappointed by the curry ramen. The taste was off and the tonkatsu was overcooked and impossible to chew through. The apps were not bad and the environment has a nice aesthetic.
The Top Ramen ğŸœ I've tried in NYC.
Must try their ramen bowls and make sure to finish till the end for surprise! Also get that extra noodles for $3 ğŸœ

One of my favorite spots to eat, me and by boyfriend LOVE coming here. The atmosphere is so nice and aesthetically pleasing, the food is delicious every time and the staff is super attentive and friendly. Their boba is also super good. The prices are really fair for the great quality and flavor. Best ramen spot!
BEST RAMEN EVER!!

Tried the famous burger at Kyuramen during our visitâ€”it definitely lives up to the hype! ğŸ”¥ Juicy, flavorful, and cooked perfectly. Fantastic service and a great vibe too. Canâ€™t wait to go back for more!
We just ordered. Haven't gotten our food yet, but so far the water was delicious and the atmosphere is cool. I'm confident this place will be 5 stars because I put it on the wishing tree!
Decorations is cute ğŸ¥°
Place is clean and spacious. Food was delicious.

Love this place so much, Iâ€™ve add it to my favorites list in a long time. Finally find a day to come with my family. Place is clean, servers are so nice, Iâ€™ve ask to change to hexagon sits, theyâ€™ve changed it right away. Love their service! Highly recommend! I went to manhattan one but didnâ€™t see hexagon sit, this is really a good place to take pictures!

I finished my bowl within a few minutes! The food is all so good. I ordered a Chicken Ramen and a chicken bao bun. Both were so good it made my mouth water as I was eating. I also ordered a Thai Iced Tea which was brought to me by a robot server! The honeycomb table was also very nice and comfortable. 10/10 experience! I would love to come back!!

My experience at Kyuramen was absolutely amazing! The combo meal was such a great dealâ€”perfectly priced and worth every penny. It delivered total satisfaction, and the service was outstandingâ€”everyone was so polite and attentive. I really loved the atmosphere, especially the beautiful wooden art message tree filled with handwritten notes and the creative honeycomb-style booths that gave the place such a unique, cozy vibe. It made me want to try everything on the menu.

The highlight for me was the Tonkotsu Curry Ramenâ€”rich, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. Honestly, it was so good Iâ€™m still thinking about it. Overall, Kyuramen really did justice to the whole dining experienceâ€”Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

This place is absolutely fantastic!!! Their food is amazing, the surroundings and place is very neat and pretty, and their staff is very friendly. Absolutely recommended for people of all ages!!!ğŸ’ğŸ’
The place is amazing. As soon as you walk in youâ€™re greeted and the wait isnâ€™t long. The food is amazing and I loved every part of it. I will be back again.

We ordered white garlic #1 ramen. The broth is ok, but the meat was delicious. The noodle is also ok. And then we got #2 and the broth taste like bamboo broth. There was a different smell rather than pork broth. It was ok but you have to try it and taste for yourself. The omurice was not that good at all. They charged $26 for the egg, fried rice and small piece of fried pork cutlet along with choice of sauce and drink. Try it once to get a taste but would not recommend coming back here after once. Really expensive place. They also have a robot that bring out the take out order and bring the drinks to customer in seat. The layout is also different. They have small area of 2 people above the stairs. The service was ok. It took around 10 or more min to get our food. Before that we had to wait 25 min. I would recommend trying out this place at least once but not more than twice a year. It's not worth it. With the inflation and tariff and the economy I would not waste more than once at this place.

Super awesome ramen spot in bayside! Their omurice is delicious! Not too salty and perfect egg consistency. Egg was perfectly runny with some solids in there. They also cut it right in front. Definitely recommend if you like egg and rice. Ramen was also great - got the tonkatsu

If youâ€™re in Bayside and craving ramen, this place is a great choice. I tried the Kyushu Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen, and it had the perfect level of spice. The broth was rich, with a hint of anise that added depth, and the noodles were perfectly al dente. We also had the matcha tiramisu, which wasnâ€™t overly sweetâ€”just how I like my desserts. The space is spacious and has a great ambiance.

è¿™é‡Œç¯å¢ƒå¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œå¾ˆæœ‰ç‰¹è‰²ï¼Œä¸­é—´æœ‰é¢—ç±»ä¼¼è®¸æ„¿æ ‘çš„ï¼Œæˆ‘æƒ³ä»¥åä¼šæˆä¸ºä¸€é¢—ç½‘çº¢æ‰“å¡æ‘ï¼Œé£Ÿç‰©çœ‹ä¸Šå»å¾ˆç²¾è‡´ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯å°ä»½äº†ç‚¹ï¼Œä½†å‘³é“è¿˜ä¸é”™ã€‚æœåŠ¡å‘˜å¾ˆçƒ­æƒ…ä»‹ç»å¥¹ä»¬æœ¬åº—çš„çƒ­å“ï¼Œç¥ç”Ÿæ„å…´éš†
Un lugar hermoso para toda la familia , me gusta mucho ver sus robots llevando bebidas y cantando el cumpleaÃ±os.

Wasnâ€™t sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised! The ramen had rich, creamy broth, and their pork buns practically melt in your mouth. The staff are very accommodating and the atmosphere is extremely homey! I would recommend, especially if youâ€™re going on a date.
This is a great restaurant and we came here as a family and food was delicious.  The ramen was tender and the drinks were great. My kids were very happy.

Wow! What an amazing experience!!
The Food, the Flavors, the Atmosphere and 10/10!
The staff are super friendly and on point. Even if they are busy you can push the call button and like magic someone will come.
Donâ€™t get me started on the robot waiter that bring you the drinks!! Amazing!!!
Top ten ramen spot in NYC!
Must go to location!

Looking for some good Ramen??
AVOID THIS PLACE. I trusted the positive reviews & took my family spending over $150. Never been so disappointedâ€¦

We ordered :
- Donkatsu Omurice
- Combo B
- another ramen (forgot)

Food. Was. UNBEARABLE. To the point it was hard to eat even tho Iâ€™m not picky. The broth tasted old, like they used old meat. The Cherry blossom Dessert? â€œSauce taste like dirty laundry and jelly is tastelessâ€ Only thing decent was popcorn chicken.

I guess this place is for vibes not food.

*ate at the only Kyuramen in VA(Virginia) last week. They might be able to help this place*

EDIT : Iâ€™d rather stay home and make instant ramen

The decor and ambience is amazing. I thought it was also cool that Tbaar is connected to them and you can order some of the drinks at your table (same owners it seems). The Gyoza was really good and the purple sweet potatoes were everything we expected, the batter was especially nice. The layout of the restaurant is exceptional. It feels so traditional but also has modern flare to it. The bamboo is very comforting (as with any wood-heavy decor). The ramen was pretty flavorful. Overall an enjoyable experience. Will be back.

Atmosphere was great, they all have the same "gimmick" in their restaurants that draw you in with a very zen wood decor with the octagon style seating.

Service is passable, neither terrible or fantastic. Dry and limited interaction with the staff and customers which is fine by me if it wasn't for the quality of the food.

I make the effort to try every ramen place I find since I love ramen and for me rarely does it dissapoint. However this particular location the spicy tonkatsu ramen broth tasted very off and was extremely salty; the bowl was rather large for the small portion of noodle and toppings they gave. It felt subpar in both quality and quantity. The diced chasu appetizer was very cold and brought out within a couple minutes of me ordering leading me to believe it was laying around for a while before serving.

Kyu Ramen is a fantastic spot for Japanese cuisine, featuring the best takoyaki I've ever tastedâ€”crispy on the outside and bursting with flavor inside. Their ramen is equally impressive, with a rich broth and perfectly cooked noodles. The ambience is warm and inviting, making it a great place to relax. Service is fast and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Overall, Kyu Ramen is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious Japanese dishes!

Loved the food, ambience, and service. We got two bowls of ramen, the omurice and pork bao buns as well as the Amazing Lemonade and the strawberry lemonade. Everything was delicious and we won free popcorn chicken because if you finish the ramen, there is a prize at the end of the bowl to win something specific. We also sat in a cute honeycomb looking booth, so my boyfriend and I felt secluded and had a lot of fun! Definitely would come back!

Do not come if youâ€™re are extremely hungry. The service was horrible. They took forever to take our order and the waiter seemed to have an attitude, did not even say hello, just â€œare you ready ?â€ Not the right way to go when working for tips. The food took extra long and when it arrived the ramen barely had any meat in it or broth, just a lot of noodles. Although it was still good I cannot say I would return here. Thereâ€™s much better options around the area like Nippon Cha.

KYURAMEN in Bayside is a go-to spot when the ramen cravings hit! The place is super spacious and impressively cleanâ€”none of those sticky table vibes, which is a huge win.

The ramen was pretty good; the broth was packed with flavor, and all the ingredients tasted fresh and top-notch. And hereâ€™s the fun part: I slurped down every last drop, and at the bottom of the bowl, there was a surpriseâ€”Iâ€™d won a free dessert for my next visit!
Beautifully decorated and great vibe. Love the takoyaki and popcorn chicken. Had the Tokyo tonkatsu shoyu ramen and the broth was very tasty.

Awesome decor and excellent food! We stopped here for lunch on a weekday. Everything was delicious. Decent sized establishment that sat 6 people. A lot of the seating is private so youâ€™re on top of other patrons. One of the most memorable decors youâ€™ll ever see. Highly recommend this place!

The decor is great, with hues of bamboo and concrete materials.  The food was good, a mix of Chinese and mostly Japanese influence.  The dessert could have been better, trying too hard to be fancy and not concentrating on bold flavors.  The set meal is not too bad, gave a taste of a bit of everything.  The place is big but not enough tables, bad use of space.  They could fit more tables, then they would have a lower wait time.  The bubble tea was great.  They have robots that bring food, but they're under utilized.

We had their ramen couple times and We tried the yakitori platter and the seafood kamameshi this time. They taste good, not too salty. It's always nice to have more food options for customers to order.
Iâ€™m often in this area, and this ramen place was a discovery for me. I highly recommend it to all ramen fans. My favorite is black garlic tonkatsu.

Date of visit: April 29th â€” Honest Review
of Kyu Ramen (Bayside, Queens)

My wife and I were looking forward to a simple ramen lunch, but unfortunately, this turned out to be one of our most disappointing dining experiences in recent memory.

The service felt rushed from the moment we sat down. I asked for a few more minutes with the menu, but the server returned in less than five minutes, which felt pushy. Not long after we got our food, we were handed takeout boxes without even being asked about dessert. It gave us the impression that they wanted to clear the table quickly, which made the whole experience feel unwelcoming.

As for the food itself, the portion sizes from Group B were quite smallâ€”especially considering the $18 price tag. Each bowl only had half an egg, and the broth tasted off, like it wasnâ€™t fresh. We visited on a Tuesday, and honestly, the soup had an odd aftertaste.

Worse, we realized both of our bowls had the same broth despite ordering different ramens: I had the Tokyo Tonkotsu and my wife ordered the Sapporo Miso. Hers tasted nothing like miso, and we suspect there may have been a mix-up in the kitchen.

We didnâ€™t mention any of this to the staff because at that point, we just wanted to finish and leave. Iâ€™ve eaten at other ramen spots in Queens and expected more, especially based on the positive reviews.

Overall, Iâ€™d rate this location 2 out of 5. Iâ€™m sure other branches might offer a better experience, but I personally wouldnâ€™t go out of my way to return to this one.
